Sentencas: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs) have been emerged as a viable technology to convert chemical energy of fuels to electrical energy efficiently and environmentally friendly.
Titulo: Multi-criteria decision-making approach assisting to select materials for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell: Electrolyte, cathode& anode

Sentencas: However, some issues hinder the successful implementation of SOFC in industrial scales, such as elevated operating temperature, electrochemical stability, high costs associated with materials and interconnectors.
Titulo: Multi-criteria decision-making approach assisting to select materials for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell: Electrolyte, cathode& anode

Sentencas: To facilitate SOFCs commercialization, Low Temperature-SOFC (LT-SOFC) technology has been introduced.
Titulo: Multi-criteria decision-making approach assisting to select materials for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell: Electrolyte, cathode& anode

Sentencas: Various materials for core components of the LT-SOFC have been suggested and their performances are investigated.
Titulo: Multi-criteria decision-making approach assisting to select materials for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell: Electrolyte, cathode& anode

Sentencas: However, operating LTSOFC faces challenges such as low ionic conductivity of electrolytes and slow rate of the oxygen reduction reaction.
Titulo: Multi-criteria decision-making approach assisting to select materials for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell: Electrolyte, cathode& anode

Sentencas: These obstacles can be overcome by selecting appropriate alternative materials that can conduct tasks preferably.
Titulo: Multi-criteria decision-making approach assisting to select materials for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell: Electrolyte, cathode& anode

Sentencas: Since assessing choices demands multiple measures, conducting a multi-criteria decision-making approach is inevitable.
Titulo: Multi-criteria decision-making approach assisting to select materials for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell: Electrolyte, cathode& anode

Sentencas: In this study, the Analytical Hierarchy Process is used to evaluate criteria and different options as alternatives for the main constituents of an LT-SOFC.
Titulo: Multi-criteria decision-making approach assisting to select materials for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell: Electrolyte, cathode& anode
